website_summaries.verdict: Durable broom with user-friendly features that is surprisingly affordable. Hands-down the best broom at a value price.
pros: A powerful broom that works for commercial and home use
Dustpan pivots for easy movement, and clips on for secure storage
cons: Some users complained that the handle is shorter than they prefer

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for me!
customer_reviews.text: I'm in a wheelchair and it is difficult to bend down to use a regular dustpan. This really fits the bill. It is the perfect height and the broom has 2 places to attach the handle. One straight and the other at a slight angle. The angle position works great for me. The bottom of the dust bin is flat and straight and seals nicely against the floor so all the dust goes in the pan and there are no annoying 'crumbs' left on the floor. I was worried when I first saw the broom that it would not sweep 'fine' dust, but it does very well. Bottom line, this works for me!
customer_reviews.author: John D. Prater

customer_reviews.title: Not good for commerical or home use
customer_reviews.text: I do not normally give bad reviews, yet this item is not good for commercial or home use. Broom bristles fanned out within a week, does not sweep up well in that condition, nor can you insert the broom into the dustpan when storing. Dustpan handle has a tab which latches into a pocket when in use, good idea except you cannot pop it back out with ease when finished sweeping. Had to cut off that tab. Broom handle does not stay firmly screwed into broom head.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Great Bucket - Awful Broom
customer_reviews.text: I have mixed opinions on this since the trash bucket is actually well made and works well. Unfortunately the broom is awful and the bucket isn't user friendly enough to go with other brooms. As you can clearly see from the pic, this broom is way shorter than an average broom. It is not practical by any means. I'm an average height (5'6) and I find it cumbersome and difficult. My 1 1/2 year old loves it but that's about it. To make matters worse, despite only using it periodically for less than a month, all the bristles began sticking out.
customer_reviews.author: Scott & Charissa Fenton

customer_reviews.title: AWKWARD TO USE AND HEAVY!
customer_reviews.text: it's heavier than my stick vac. And one hole for the pole would have been sufficient. It' makes the broom twist/spin when I try to use it. One centered hole would have been better.. I see why they have a big/muscular man using it in the ad. I really hate it. I just wanted it to sweep up stray crumbs and a bit of dust.This is something made for a machine shop/factory.
customer_reviews.author: Skylark

customer_reviews.title: Great broom for outside
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this broom for outside use. I wanted something compact enough to fit in our exterior storage bin and sturdy enough to sweep on concrete. The broom serves our needs perfectly. Like that it's black in color. Other bright colored brooms look so grimy after a short time. Love that it has a dust pan that has its own handle. Love that the whole thing stands in its own. Very happy with the purchase. Other reviewers complain about the stuff bristles. They are stiff, which is best for outside use.
customer_reviews.author: Zeke's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Too short
customer_reviews.text: Was a waste, when I purchased this product it didn't say 3ft talk. I'm in a wheelchair and this thing is still too small. The dustpan is fine, but broom is a huge problem. Too short.
customer_reviews.author: L Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Quality is fine .. design, not so much
customer_reviews.text: The mechanism that attaches the dustpan to the handle is inside of the dustpan. I never considered this, but every time you empty the dustpan, the contents get caught up in that mechanism. It's a pretty bad design. I used it once and recognized the flaw. It's surprising the manufacturer went ahead and made a bazillion of these.
customer_reviews.author: MagaDumdum

customer_reviews.title: broom not good, dust pan difficult to handle plus needed rubber ...
customer_reviews.text: poorly designed, difficult to use, broom not good, dust pan difficult to handle plus needed rubber gasket or something at the lip so that dust would actually go into the pan instead of stopping at the lip. Took up too much space in out tiny house. Threw it away just to quit glaring at it
customer_reviews.author: Silver Fox 42

customer_reviews.title: Short handles
customer_reviews.text: The advertisement is correct. 3' height. I'm only 5'1 and this broom is awkward and heavy for me to use. From the base of the broom to the end of the handle is only 28 1/2". It would have been nice if it came with another extension bar so the consumer could decide on whether to keep it short or extend it up a bit. I'll continue to use the dustpan, but with a different broom. The ones from the dollar store works just fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: WREN

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I use a wheelchair and bending over to get debris into a standard dustpan was difficult. I'm a little top heavy and was always afraid of toppling out of the chair. Of course the standard broom handle's length is surplus to requirements. Plus I don't remember ever having a dustpan that didn't let bits of debris slip past. This item solves both problems very nicely. The broom doesn't look as efficient as standard household brooms. Once I've finished sweeping I can see that I got everything swept up in one pass, a new experience for me. Now I can keep my kitchen floor debris free with much, much less effort.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Bee 1321

customer_reviews.title: Handle doesn't extend
customer_reviews.text: As is, it's a nice set. The broom gathers very well. I am a hairdresser, and it picks up hair all day with no problem. The dustbin holds a lot, and empties easily. The reason I only gave it 3 stars is b/c the handle doesn't extend. I am under 5'4", and it's too short to comfortably use, and I look ridiculous while doing so. As this is the first combo of this type I have purchased, I didn't know to look for an extendable handle. I guess I assumed it was a non-issue...thinking that, 'of course, they would all have extendable handles' 🤦‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: Sunnie =)

customer_reviews.title: READ DESCRIPTION CAREFULLY BEFORE PURCHASING
customer_reviews.text: READ THE REVIEWS AND DESCRIPTION BEFORE PURCHASING! I didn’t realize this broom would be meant for a toddler. When assembling I thought it was missing a pole, nope, just a short/useless broom. I purchased this to avoid back issues but this size is just not ideal! This is coming from someone who isn’t a tall person either, at 5’2 this broom is still very short. This is partly my fault for not reading the description carefully so my advise...READ DESCRIPTION CAREFULLY BEFORE PURCHASING, the picture is deceiving.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Sparrow

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and comes in handy.
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this product was a great surprise. It comes packed in five total pieces and took all of two minutes to assemble. The handles of both the dust pan, and broom click together, and the dust pan snaps into the handle with ease. This is a very handy design, and I've found myself sweeping up far more than I ever have as a bachelor. I'm 6'-0" tall, and the handles are plenty long for me to sweep up without bending over. I see this product lasting many years of light to moderate use in my home.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Groux

customer_reviews.title: Read the Description better than I did
customer_reviews.text: Just a few initial impressions. I'm 5'11" and this short broom makes me have to bend over slightly. It's probably fine for shorter people, just not me. It feels like a toy. However, I'm impressed with the quality of the dustpan. It seems like a solid piece of industrial goods. There's something about it that makes it seem professional grade, even if it isn't dripping with innovative features. I am happy to have a nice dustpan and am almost willing to throw the broom away. Or maybe I'll give it to my five year old, it's a great size for her.
customer_reviews.author: P. C. Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Works Just Fine for Me--Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mainly for the dustpan. I have a wonky, painful hip, and I realized that my regular dustpan had become an instrument of torture because bending over is so difficult. This set took care of that quite nicely, and I liked it as soon as I started using it. The broom is surprisingly effective as well, and the whole thing collapses for easy storage. Debris doesn't fall out of the dustpan, either. It got the acid test the day it arrived when I broke a glass in my kitchen. I'd recommend it to anyone with a similar disability.
customer_reviews.author: NanaTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: This was order for my son
customer_reviews.text: My son is 12 and likes to help with chores, the old broom as small and short. He said that he wanted a new dustpan and broom. We did not hesitate not even a minute. This one has good quality and lightweight. It is pretty useful for around the house, of course, not for use outdoors. but you can if needed for casual incidents. Pretty much use it every day. Still too early to mention about long term reliability. But it seems is pretty standard for this type of product. Hope it will last more than one year.
customer_reviews.author: Cowwyhippoandbubu

customer_reviews.title: Too small even though I'm not that tall.
customer_reviews.text: Should have returned this. Definitely don't use it as a set. I'm 5ft7 and the broom is too short. The dust pan, with a longer broom, works, ok, but I got it for yard work and the mouth is kinda narrow. When I go to empty it I just can't shake it over the can, by the handle, I have to hold it and shake it from the dust pan. Stopper on top of the broom comes off when you try to sweep and the whole process is awkward and back laboring.
customer_reviews.author: TReezy

customer_reviews.title: Great dustpan and broom.
customer_reviews.text: Great dust pan. Bottom lip is firm, stays flat against the floor. The pan swings up easily to keep dirt and trash inside. The broom bristles are stiff and sweep cleanly. It has a snap attachment to connect the two. And caps on the top of each have openings made for hanging. Other reviews complained the broom handle was too short or not adequate to sweep with. Well, this broom was NOT made for sweeping a whole room. It was MADE FOR sweeping piles of dust/debris into the dustpan.
customer_reviews.author: lizzie0104

customer_reviews.title: Pooper Picker Upper
customer_reviews.text: Great quality product! This is what you see cleaning staffs use in commercial businesses such as movie theaters etc. I use it to clean up my dogs droppings. I live in a four-story condo building on the top floor, so my 5 pound Minpin uses one of our balconies for her business. So something like this is a requirement for me and my little muchkin :)
customer_reviews.author: AmberTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this to clean debris off tennis courts. It has been about 2-3 weeks now and the metal attachment keeps wobbling at first I thought it was the handle unscrewing from the brush connector but it is the handle starting to wobble. The mouth of the dustpan is now chipped and I am concerned how it will keep if I don't return it. I prefer a longer broom handle but I do like the sturdiness/stiffness ob the broom bristles.
customer_reviews.author: TennisCoachHall

customer_reviews.title: Go to your local hardware store...this is crap!
customer_reviews.text: Not what I wanted. No instructions...why are their 2 holes on too of the broom???? Bulky....and the knobs on.top of the handles are loose!!!! Cant tighten.....go to Menards, Home.Depot or your local hardware store and look at it before.purchasing...who knew a broom and dustpan would have issues?? Pictures to come!
customer_reviews.author: Cody Balody

customer_reviews.title: Broom is heavy and too short
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to push the dustpan down flat and the broom is heavy. Whoever made this broom must have made it for short people. I'm not tall at 5'5" but having to lean over to use the broom is the pits. The broom itself is also a bit heavy and the bristles are too hard. Not the best but serves the purpose I guess because I was looking for a dustpan with a long handle. Just use a different broom
customer_reviews.author: mauicatwoman

customer_reviews.title: Way too short!
customer_reviews.text: I read customer reviews but failed to see any on how short this broom and dustpan handles are. They are only 3 feet total so you have to stood over to use them! Luckily, my O'cedar broom handle fit right into this new one so I made it workable, just a bright yellow handle on my black broom now. Ideally I would use one of the broom pieces to lengthen the dustpan handle, but that won't work, so I am looking for another broom handle to replace the whole thing. Overall, the broom works great now!
customer_reviews.author: Donna S.

customer_reviews.title: Garbage. Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: It is relatively lightweight. It is relatively sturdy. It was easy to assemble. But thats it. The bristles of the broom are so rigid and so far apart that they do not sweep up any dust or small particles. The dust pan does not easily open and close so you have to pry it open and then force it closed. Will not stand on its own-you have to lean it against the wall. Next Tuesday is trash day and this will be out at the curb.
customer_reviews.author: birdznmore

customer_reviews.title: Cute, OK, not the best broom
customer_reviews.text: It’s neat the way the broom clips into the dustpan. It’s basically functional., Unfortunately that really stiff bristles and shortness of it make it difficult to get anything but large pieces up into the dustpan and also difficult to wield.
customer_reviews.author: D. Diana

customer_reviews.title: Helpful since it's hard for me to bend down
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to put together. It still works fine, but unfortunately, it just stays in the one position (fortunately, it's the position I need to sweep into it, so that's okay). At first, it worked the way it was supposed to, but after a couple days, it got stuck. Ergonomic? I would prefer it to have a longer handle, but this at least prevents me from having to bend all the way down to the floor, and the dustpan holds quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Alyce-Kay Ruckelshaus

customer_reviews.title: Small, compact broom
customer_reviews.text: I bought this broom because I wanted a small compact one that I would be able to take apart and put back together to save space. For that reason it serves it’s purpose. I did receive it a little banged up, which is why I deducted a star. The bristles were a little uneven and messed up and the bin part looks a bit melted/deformed, but only if you look closely you’d be able to tell.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a great buy
customer_reviews.text: It took a while but I’m glad I finally received it! It’s super sturdy and just an overall great purchase. My only complaint is that it is a little too short and should have an extender mechanism.
customer_reviews.author: Jaye

customer_reviews.title: Shorter than i expected, but great after fix.
customer_reviews.text: I saw that it said 3 foot height, but this was way smaller than I expected. I couldnt even use the broom. I expected to maybe be able to at least reach the top of the handle, but I ended up having to bend over just to sweep. Ended up going to Menards and buying a longer broom handle for both the broom and the dustpan. Works great now, love the lint/hair remover built into the dustpan. Great stiff bristles make this feel very high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Not good at all. Bleh!
customer_reviews.text: I really dislike this brush/pan set. The brush doesn't fit easily into the pan so the bristles stand out to the sides and creates more of a mess. We wanted to use it for sweeping up stray kitty litter, but besides the above, it rattles with an awful racket. Looking for something better already.
customer_reviews.author: Animal lover

customer_reviews.title: ... and have used many different kinds of broom/dustpan combos like this. This is by far the best one ...
customer_reviews.text: I have worked as an usher at a movie theater and have used many different kinds of broom/dustpan combos like this. This is by far the best one I've used. The dustpan is easy to stand up by itself and isn't super loose. Due to the fact that it isn't real loose you can easily dump the dustpan into the garbage without having to touch anything other than the handle. Also the dustpan has a good weight that's not too heavy and not too light meaning when you sweep into the dustpan you don't have alot going under it. Highly reccommended.
customer_reviews.author: A.Jiang

customer_reviews.title: Very handy
customer_reviews.text: I got this set to allow me to sweep up. I was told by another person that tried it that they thought the broom was a little short, however, since I am in a wheelchair, the broom was perfect for me. You can sit the broom in the dust pan and clip it to the dust pans handle and it will sit against the wall, taking up little storage room. I find it very handy!
customer_reviews.author: Karvin Spurgeon

customer_reviews.title: It just does what it should.
customer_reviews.text: Also I wouldn’t call it light weight, it’s a perfect weight so it doesn’t tip over, but not so heavy that you get issue using it. Handle on the broom is a tiny bit uncomfortable but works fine.
customer_reviews.author: stewi

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done for it's purpose.
customer_reviews.text: This is not the most study and rugged product you can buy, but for the price it gets the job done. It is meant for light duty. Sweep the kitchen, bathroom or spot cleaning on hard surfaces. I don't think you are going to sweep up leaves outside or anything like that. It was made to fill specific needs. Convenience (broom attaches to handle of basket) and it is very lightweight. Small in size (easy to store away). Handle it gently and it should last quite a long time. Abuse it with force and it will crumble like a sugar cookie in milk.
customer_reviews.author: Froggie

customer_reviews.title: Broom too short and dustpan not flush with floor to pick up.  Items go underneath it.
customer_reviews.text: Item too short. Dust pan is not flush enough to floor for pick up. Everything goes right under the dust pan and not inside of it. When packages are ordered from Amazon...most times they are just left on the front. I have a note on my door and they are still just left there without ringing the bell as requested.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Tolson

customer_reviews.title: Duo dustpan
customer_reviews.text: It worked the first time I used it, now it doesn't. The pan is supposed to automatically flip back up, and mine doesn't, Only did it once.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Broom and pan
customer_reviews.text: Would be great if handle was longer. Short is hard on the back. Both broom and pan have short handles.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Broom frays and dustpan lock broke
customer_reviews.text: This won’t last long in my work truck. The part that locks dustpan in place broke after 3 uses
customer_reviews.author: ashley

customer_reviews.title: Super sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made product. I have purchased others like it in the past and they tended to be smaller and flimsy. This product has a pretty large disposal container. I didn't give it 5 stars because the broom is more like the old fireplace soft bristle brooms and I like a firmer broom as I use it outdoors around our car wash and vacuums and the firmer brooms pick up debris better.
customer_reviews.author: D. Conwell

customer_reviews.title: Broomstick is weighted too heavy for a stick dustpan set
customer_reviews.text: I consider myself an expert in broom and porter sets. I've worked in a megaplex for 5 years of my life and swept up a lot of trash and popcorn. This product is priced well. The dustpan is good. My main issue is that the broom is way too heavy. It should be more balanced or heavier near the head of the broom. Instead, it is heavy in the metal stick and handle, this hinders the ability to sweep well. Noticable difference in performance with wooden broomstick or plastic broomstick.
customer_reviews.author: SE

customer_reviews.title: Awesome dustpan
customer_reviews.text: The dustpan is flat and even with the floor which makes it easy to sweep dirt in without having to bend over. I had previously purchased two other brands of standing dustpans and they were warped so that when you tried to sweep dirt into them it just went underneath the dustpan. I have had no problems with this one. The broom is shorter than average so be aware.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie L. Gallegos

customer_reviews.title: Good set for the price
customer_reviews.text: This broom/dust pan set is quite an upgrade from the cheap one I had. I like the way the dust pan flips up so the dirt doesn't slide off when walking it to the garbage. I am 5'9" and I do not have to stoop to sweep, as this set is tallee than the one I am replacing. The price was reasonable also.
customer_reviews.author: MizzTea

customer_reviews.title: Nice but could be better.
customer_reviews.text: I got my broom and dust pan set yesterday. I love the dust pan. It works on all types of surfaces, even porcelean tile. The broom itself is nice and stiff, but not too stiff. The only thing that i dislike is the length of the handle for the broom. It is too short, and causes my wrist to hurt after prolonged usage. The good part is that it is an easy fix to expand the handle... both the broom and the dust pan are threaded, therefore any threaded broom handle or paint roller handle can be used on this set. So if you desire a longer handle, just swap it out.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Y.

customer_reviews.title: Ah, it’s ok
customer_reviews.text: The scoop has an issue “locking” open, makes it very difficult to close at times. I actually cracked the side of the scoop trying to do so. The handles on both the broom and scoop could be much better quality. The broom is very heavy compared to others I’ve used, the bristles are trimmed at a angle which I found to be different.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Broom is short, but acceptable for short term use
customer_reviews.text: I used to work menial jobs and fell in love with the ease of use of the standing dustpan design. The dustpan is great, but the broom's short handle makes it difficult to use for an extended period of time (although I do like how it can be used as an angle broom). I went ahead and gave this product a five star review, because I bought it for the dustpan and it works great for the ocassional mess. If you plan on using this for large areas you should get a full size broom or look at a different product.
customer_reviews.author: mason

customer_reviews.title: Now that said it is a great deal for a dust pan very heavy dust pan ...
customer_reviews.text: First let me point out for those complaining about the height of the broom...Yes it is short, but this is not a broom for sweeping a kitchen just for sweeping stuff into the dust pan. They are supposed to be short that way you can hold both pieces in each hand. Now that said it is a great deal for a dust pan very heavy dust pan and broom is a good stiff bristled brush. Does the job it is supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap not sturdy broom
customer_reviews.text: The broom is horrible, hard to sweep anything up, this is the worst broom I have ever had. The dust pan was ok, not the best but better than the broom. The shipping was great. I would not recommend wasting your money for this broom and dust pan.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this and tried to use it immediately on my tile kitchen floor. Did not work at all, did not sweep anything into dust pan, pan was hard to empty, heavy, tended to fall backwards when lifted making it almost impossible to empty into trash can. Definitely will take two hands just to lift short distance. I am used to carrying 40 lb bags of dog food and mulch around house. This was very heavy for me using only one hand. Too awkward to empty unless you have three hands. Sorry, broom did not even pick up large particals on my floor, let alone the sand tracked in from my dogs and grandchildren on a daily basis.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Cat Litter Cleanups
customer_reviews.text: Bought to have in the utility room, which is also our cats' bathroom. Very handy to quickly clean up the litter that they manage to leave behind. (One is, I am sure, part sand turtle.) I like that the dustpan will lock open so the whole unit will stand up. Keeps it out of the way, and we didn't need to add any hangers to the wall for it. Large dustpan, too. Really pleased with that. We sweep dust bunnies out from under furniture into that pan and they don't get lost or swept back out.
customer_reviews.author: C. Posley

customer_reviews.title: Way too short!
customer_reviews.text: Unless you are buying this for a child do not buy. I’m 5’4” and the handles are way too short for me. I have to bend over to sweep which is ridiculous. Should have returned it but I’ll give it to my nephew. It’s also very lightweight and flimsy. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Brigitte

customer_reviews.title: Not a great product
customer_reviews.text: It works.... but was way too awkward to use. It was also very bulky and does not stand up on it's own well. It topples over too easily when folded. The broom is not very efficient as the bristles do not sweep well, they seem too stiff compared to my other stand-up broom & dustpan sets. I ended up selling it to an apartment manager for scooping trash on his property. Might be ok for a garage or basement type setting but I'd use a different broom for sure.
customer_reviews.author: bd

customer_reviews.title: Handle is too short
customer_reviews.text: I would LOVE to say this is a total 5 but i need a longer handle to use this. It sweeps very well, assembles easily, well made. If the maker could provide another hanger that could be attached to a longer handle, that would be great! I have a longer handle but no way to hang it. I can't bend over to sweep and the shorter handle makes it hard for me. I did read the description and thought it would be fine. it's a 4+ otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo fan

customer_reviews.title: Happy with it although broom could be better
customer_reviews.text: So far I like it.. I knew that the broom would be short but I like that I can easily sweep up a mess and that it fits together nicely into the dust pan for storage. The dust pan is great. Very sturdy and the swivel is a must and works well. One star off because as others have said, the broom strands are night tight enough and it does not do a great job of sweeping up direct. It works ok but not great. Still happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: carmens kindle 3

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Construction, Pleasantly Surprised
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for small space storage, heavy construction, easy to assemble but broom bristles can get caught & splay if you're not careful putting it into the dustpan....otherwise exactly what we were looking for at the right price.
customer_reviews.author: C. Anselmo

customer_reviews.title: Carlisle 36141503 Duo-Pan Dustpan & Lobby Broom Combo
customer_reviews.text: I like the dustpan. It is easy to sweep the dirt into the pan; however, I have 2 issues with it. 1) I think the broom is too short. I am 5' 3" and thought this is a good height. But after using it for few minutes, I find that it was hurting my back because I had to bend over when sweeping. No good. I need to change the stick. 2) when I am ready to throw away the dirt from the dustpan, it was hard to put it into the trash can without using my hands.
customer_reviews.author: Msuperwoman

customer_reviews.title: Long-lasting and Functional
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased two sets of these now to be used at work. They are a good height, long-lasting and are easy to use. The dustpan is actually easy to use and you are able to easily sweep the dirt in to the pan. If we need another set, I would definitely go with this set again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wish it can be stronger
customer_reviews.text: i like the Design idea That you can separate the Stick to save space but I have to say the assembled stick is not as strong though. I used it on my backyard and it took me a bit mor effort to sweep. But if just for indoor should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these sets purely because I love the one we have at work so much and decided I want one for home as well. I love that the dustpan snaps up and down making it great to use when you have it hung up.
customer_reviews.author: Djanice Azevedo

customer_reviews.title: GREAT
customer_reviews.text: To begain with i have very bad hips and any bending or stooping is extremely difficult to do. This set has shorter handels than most,so i thought that i would like to try it to see how it would work out ... and YES i love the length of the handles on both broom and dust pan. I was very suprised to notice how much more weight this set has compared to the other much bigger and longer ones, but the weight (to me) is only a small matter in this case. cjp
customer_reviews.author: cjp

customer_reviews.title: I like it, would buy it again
customer_reviews.text: Handy-dandy little kit. Saves my back and keeps the wood stove area neat. That little clip that holds the broom to the bin is very 'forgiving' and will come unclipped when you want it to and when you don't. All in all, I like it, would buy it again. As a matter of fact, I just bought one for a friend with new puppy that leaves dog-bone pieces on the floor. I'd have given it fives stars if it were a little beefier.
customer_reviews.author: Musician491

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is intended to do!
customer_reviews.text: Got this one to replace the one I had, but it has stiffer bristles than mine had. It's great for hard surfaces, but I wanted on with softer bristles to catch the dust. Still would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: km in Florida

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use from my wheelchair
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. My help had a habit of putting the broom into the dust bin without making sure all of the broom wires were inside. Now the wires are staying stray out to the sides or pointed up. I would like to purchase just the broom lower part since it is removable. Pleas let me know if this is possible since I use this broom everyday. I have removed some of the wires sticking out or up but this has lessened the broom the effectiveness of the broom, plus it is time to remove them with a wire cutters. Please respond to djseven12@gmail.com
customer_reviews.author: Deborah L.

customer_reviews.title: Great for home use -- especially if you have pets
customer_reviews.text: This isn't an expensive item, but it's nicely thought out. The pan is the best part: It has decent capacity, is fairly lightweight, tough, and has a useful toothed edge that's great for scraping animal hair off your broom. The broom itself is rather heavy and poorly balanced. It sweeps well, and will be fine for quick jobs around the house. But if you're in a commercial setting where someone is carrying this thing around for hours at a time, you'll certainly need a lighter broom with a longer handle. I'd recommend this set to anyone with wooden or tile floors -- especially if you have shedding pets.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Baskind

customer_reviews.title: Unusable
customer_reviews.text: The broom is ridiculously short. I’m a tall guy and my hands don’t reach to below my knees, so they only way I could use this broom was bent over like the hunchback of Notre Dame. I like the dustpan though
customer_reviews.author: Woodwose

customer_reviews.title: It is sturdy but short
customer_reviews.text: I think I assembled it correctly. there were no directions, thus I had to put it together and reassemble a couple of times. It does the job, however the handle for the broom is short, thus you have to bend over a lot. I thought it would be a lot longer. All in all, it is doing the job.
customer_reviews.author: knjw

customer_reviews.title: Good product - worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This does the job, indoors and out - it's a back saver.. At first glance the brush looks like junk, but to my surprise it cleans up all the dust from my wife's Swiftering piles. Two small quibbles: 1) if you lift the pan over a trash can and rotate it to empty, the handle starts to unscrew if your going the wrong way, and 2) the plastic clip that holds the brush for storage is constantly turning and sliding down the main handle. I might drill those two points and put small screws in to correct the shortcomings. That said, I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Al D

customer_reviews.title: Great dustpan.  Absolutely crap broom.
customer_reviews.text: Bristles on the broom are cheap plastic and get bent at odd angles every time you put the broom into the dustpan. No matter how careful you are. I'm particularly annoyed because the dustpan itslef is one of the better ones I've used with a nice edge that picks up most dirt. With a decent broom-head this would be really nice but....
customer_reviews.author: WSK

customer_reviews.title: Great dustpan, I wish the broom handle was longer
customer_reviews.text: Everything works really well. I especially love the dustpan because it can hold a bunch before you have to empty it. The only thing I wish was different was the broom length. It's a little short even for a quick sweep up. I should have read better the product description, but for a suggestion
customer_reviews.author: Grace R.

customer_reviews.title: Great little broom
customer_reviews.text: Great broom for what I needed! It’s light weight and relatively small - if you’re looking for something heavy duty, this is not the broom. If you want something light and easy to handle for quick clean ups/sweeping around small areas (like kitchens and bathrooms) this is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Mackennzie D

customer_reviews.title: Just an Ordinary Broom
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. Nothing special. Does the job well enough, but it actually hurts my hands while using it. Haha. I think it's the thickness of the pole maybe or the fact that the pole itself is on the shorter side so I can't hold it correctly and have to also bend over so much? I don't know. But like I said, for the price it gets it's job done and I'll be keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: stacy klepach

customer_reviews.title: Sturdiness is okay but does not last
customer_reviews.text: Use it for my concession stand, had to put it together a few time, handle keeps falling off but I just snap it back on, the hold snap unit to keep the dustpan open failed, stop working after a few try’s I just threw the darn thing away and invented on a commercial dustpan, this item is not worth the time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Chef Rameses

customer_reviews.title: The broom is sooo short, it is like a half of broom!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 B&B's an d a restaurant so I use a lot of brooms, dust pans, etc. This broom is like half the size of what it should be making it really difficult to use. I wish I knew that before I bought it. It may be good for a child but I am only 5'5" and it is way too small to use for me.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Wasil

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: Okay so I got this for my mom and it was easy to assemble and it was a nice little set of broom and dustpan but I think it was missing a piece because the broom stick was kinda short so if you’re tall, this might not be for you lol other than that, it’s a cute set!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda R.

customer_reviews.title: Feather duster!!!
customer_reviews.text: The magic duo isn't for any ordinary job, oh no! What you say it's used for, the ordinary sweep n go. Drop a tissue - to lazy to bed use this item. Angle sweep unscrew the 3ft stickamagig and screw back in. Item not meant for tall people.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Coretto

customer_reviews.title: Great dust pan and broom combo
customer_reviews.text: The only issue that I have with it is that the set is a little shorter than I expected. So if you are really tall, you are gonna feel like you are using something that was made for a child. Otherwise that dust pan is great because it is designed with the bottom catch lip flat on the floor so it does a really great job a picking up even the smallest pieces of dirt. The broom is very sturdy and I love using the set.
customer_reviews.author: S.Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Short handle.
customer_reviews.text: It is definitely for small spills. Not advisable for whole room sweeping as the handle is quite short. I am only 5 feet tall and it is still very short for me.
customer_reviews.author: Scent Care

customer_reviews.title: Just Ok
customer_reviews.text: The Brush on this broom could have been Better , Bristles are far apart so as to not work on finer particles :( more of a utility broom not so much for kitchen
customer_reviews.author: Nailgirl

customer_reviews.title: If yours doesn't sweep the dust under the bin every time, then you'll love it.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this combo as it brings back my days working at a movie theatre. The only problem I have found is the gap between the lip of the bin and the ground. I will attempt to melt it and pull it down, but this is the second one we've bought with this same issue. It leaves dust under the bin each time and you end up chasing your tale trying to get the last of the dust. Other than that maddening game, it's fabulous.
customer_reviews.author: Alanna L

customer_reviews.title: Great product, light, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for myself and loved the ease of use and ability to fit in a small space so I bought two more for my brother and my father’s homes. My father uses it to keep leaves off his patio even. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon S.

customer_reviews.title: Designed for tiny people
customer_reviews.text: Something went wrong here. These can't possibly be designed for the average size person. They have to be designed for kid's doing chores. Not adults. Definitely not adults. I tried to unscrew the top of the pole, hoping that it would extend. It doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie G Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Dustpan works great, broom is high quality but awkward
customer_reviews.text: I use my regular broom with this awesome dustpan. It is tight to the floor and I don't have to bend over any more yay! The broom has that short handle which is fine if you are just sweeping a little spot but to do a whole floor it's not practical.
customer_reviews.author: tvshrine

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: the dust pan is perfect for what I need it for. no more bending down to the floor to pick up dust after sweeping the floor. very convenient and the dust pan it very durable and solid. the attached broom is perfect to sweeping the dirt into the dustpan.
customer_reviews.author: arnold

customer_reviews.title: no instructions
customer_reviews.text: Sent this to my elderly Mother because she cant bend down too easy. No instructions included how to assemble this product. So now it sits in her laundry room until someone comes along to put together!
customer_reviews.author: Dottie

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: This was an awesome purchase! I love you don’t have to hold the dust pan because it stands up by itself and you don’t have to bend over because I’ve had back pain in the past. The grandchildren love to clean up too because they think it’s fun to use so I have helpers now!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Saddler

customer_reviews.title: Too big and too heavy for quick pickups
customer_reviews.text: The only reason for purchasing this set is to have something easy and nimble to do quick pick ups. This just doesn't fit the bill. It's too big. It hogs up storage space in the broom closet. It is heavy and stiff to uncouple the two pieces. It doesn't slide around easily. Pickup is okay. Essentially, it works but lacks any elegance in styling, engineering, usability or design. Most likely, it's better suited for a shop tool than a home.
customer_reviews.author: Deb L.

customer_reviews.title: Bristles not durable at all so far, handle is too short
customer_reviews.text: Ok Ive used this for a DAY. Already some bristles are jacked up and sticking out. I didnt do anything crazy; just normal sweeping of my kitchen, hallway, foyer and sunroom. And the handle is way too short. If I was under 4'9", this might be perfect. I'm thinking about returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Uula

customer_reviews.title: Hilariously small broom, be careful buyers!
customer_reviews.text: The broom was so small and tiny! I would have given it one star but the dustpan was great enough to just paid with another broom. The height is unusable and yeah it's easy to be tricked! Buyers beware!
customer_reviews.author: Cut-Rate Nate

customer_reviews.title: Like other reviews said
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviews said, the dustpan is pretty awesome, and you don't end up having to re-sweep too much. I hadn't paid attention to the height of the handles - I'm only 5-2 so most things are not too short for me. Both of these handles are REALLY short. The dustpan isn't too bad (they are the same height), but the broom height you really notice. I don't think I could use this broom for a long time without irritating my back, but it does the trick for a quick sweep.
customer_reviews.author: jenna

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, sturdy too...
customer_reviews.text: Great strong and wide enough broom set for regular house use, can be used for commercial purposes also.... Not too light weight, but thus tells the quality....
customer_reviews.author: Anoop

customer_reviews.title: Good - but short handle makes hard to use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so my kids can help out sweeping. I like that the dustpan handle locks upright so it stands without any difficulty. I do not like that the handle is short. It works fine for when my kids use it, but if I use it I have to stoop over and it's not comfortable at all to use. And I'm only 5'4".
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Great broom and dustpan, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to use broom and dust pan system. I like that the broom snaps to the dustpan handle, great for storage. It's also fairly compact so I'm able to keep it tucked away in a corner of my kitchen and easily pull it out to sweep up the endless toddler food messes that are always, always on the floor! I'm fairly tall, (5'10") so I do have to stoop a bit to use it, but oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda J

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Needed a dustpan with long handle it’s a little bulky but sturdy Broom bristles could be better but easy to assemble and used it and stored it so it’s mine !
customer_reviews.author: lisbeth R.

customer_reviews.title: Not Easy to Assemble
customer_reviews.text: It is not easy to assemble.. The two pieces that formed the handle would not screw together no matter how I tried it. I would never purchase a Carlisle product again and will undoubtedly return this product by the deadline.
customer_reviews.author: gregory

customer_reviews.title: Dust under the dust pan!?
customer_reviews.text: Dust pan doesn’t really touch the ground completely. It’s one of those products who ever designed it never used it even once. That being said the dust just kind goes under the dust pan thus defeating its purpose. Needs like a rubber lip or something that touches the ground!
customer_reviews.author: David Shook

customer_reviews.title: Good budget set
customer_reviews.text: The handles are not super snug, and rattle some, but they do the job for a fair price. I do wish they were longer, but I received the item that was described. Cant complain about that.
customer_reviews.author: Noah Blevins

customer_reviews.title: Well made and very durable
customer_reviews.text: This is smaller than expected but is made of good quality. It's been battle tested by my two year old boy who likes to bang both pieces against the floor. It also has very sturdy bristles on the broom and picks up quite a bit more dirt in comparison to my other store bought broom. It has a small handle so keep that in mind when purchasing. If you have back problems or are tall( like myself )and have an issue with bending, it might not be the best option. Overall, great broom and pan set.
customer_reviews.author: Darth Polluter

customer_reviews.title: I’ll be looking for a new broom
customer_reviews.text: Very average product - at the end of the day it gets the job done but it’s not easy to use and I actually felt like I was fighting the thing the whole time I was cleaning. I will use it for a few days until I can go out and get a proper broom that’s a lot easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I'm returning this item. The handles come in two pieces but I couldn't attach them together. One piece has holes that you'd expect a screw to go in. Instead the other handle piece has little retractable metal bullets that are supposed to fit in the holes, I guess. I couldn't get the pieces to lock together, and there were no directions in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: It’s very heavy to use, my arms start paining after using this for a short time and I do carry my baby all the time so my arms are not that weak. The dustpan doesn’t fold so it takes a lot of space.
customer_reviews.author: FS

customer_reviews.title: Love the dustpan, not so much the broom.
customer_reviews.text: The dustpan and broom set is a good set for quick clean-up. I am taking one star off because the broom is too short and makes my lower back hurt after a few minutes of using it, the broom handle is also not ergonomically designed and hurts to grip in my hand as I am sweeping. The dustpan is my favourite of the two pieces because there is less bending down to collect crumbs and orts.
customer_reviews.author: Appleberry

product_meta.title: Carlisle 36141503 Duo-Pan Dustpan & Lobby Broom Combo, 3 Foot Overall Height, Black
product_meta.description: Carlisle 36141503 Duo-Pan Dustpan & Lobby Broom Combo, 3 Foot Overall Height, Black
feature_bullets: Locking Bail – Dustpan pivots providing secure debris collection and easy, hands-free emptying
Folds Flat – Pivoting bail and integrated hanging holes allow the broom and dustpan to hang for space-efficient storage
Broom Comb – Serrated edge of the dustpan combs dust, hair and debris out of broom bristles ideal for pet hair and other fine particles
Steel Handle – Vinyl coated steel handle designed for daily use in commercial and residential environments
Indoor / Outdoor – Unflagged bristles make the broom ideal for use on a wide variety of surfaces including concrete and carpet

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
